benchmarks.name: DBGBench
benchmarks.description: 291 (in)correct patches from real software professionals for 27 real bugs in C for the qualitative evaluation of automated repair techniques
benchmarks.title: Where is the Bug and How is it Fixed? An Experiment with Practitioners
benchmarks.authors: M. Boehme, E.O. Soremekun, S. Chattopadhyay, E. Ugherughe, A. Zeller
benchmarks.venue: European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE)

benchmarks.name: Codeflaws
benchmarks.description: 3902 bugs from Codeforces programming competition for evaluating program repair tools across different defect classes
benchmarks.title: Codeflaws: A Programming Competition Benchmark for Evaluating Automated Program Repair Tools
benchmarks.authors: S.H. Tan, J. Yi, Yulis, S. Mechtaev, A. Roychoudhury
benchmarks.venue: International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE) — Poster Track

benchmarks.name: ManyBugs
benchmarks.description: Automated program repair benchmark that consists of 185 defects from large popular open-source projects
benchmarks.title: The ManyBugs and IntroClass Benchmarks for Automated Repair of C Programs
benchmarks.authors: C. Le Goues, N. Holtschulte, E. K. Smith, Y. Brun, P.Devanbu, S. Forrest, W. Weimer

benchmarks.name: IntroClass
benchmarks.description: Automated program repair benchmark that consists of 998 defects in small student-written programming assignments
benchmarks.title: The ManyBugs and IntroClass Benchmarks for Automated Repair of C Programs
benchmarks.authors: C. Le Goues, N. Holtschulte, E. K. Smith, Y. Brun, P. Devanbu, S. Forrest, W. Weimer

benchmarks.name: Defects4j
benchmarks.description: A database of existing faults to enable controlled testing studies for Java
benchmarks.title: Defects4J: A Database of Existing Faults to Enable Controlled Testing Studies for Java Programs
benchmarks.authors: R. Just, D. Jalali, M. D. Ernst
benchmarks.venue: International Symposium on Software Testing and Analysis (ISSTA)
